跿跿跿

跿字的基本解释

跿
tú
〔跿跔（
j?）〕光着脚，如“虎挚之士，跿跿科头，贯颐奋戟者，至不可胜计也。”

跿字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tú］
［《集韻》同都切，平模，定。］
见“跿跔”。

跿字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【足字部】　跿； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1226第14
【集韻】同都切，音徒。【類篇】跿跔，跣也。或从徒作蹝。　又【史記·張儀傳】跿跔科頭。【註】偏舉一足曰跿跔。互詳跔字註。

跿字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
跿字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Slap
tú
〔跿跔(
j?)] Bare feet, such as "The tiger's true man, the head of the head, the one who is eager to fight with the halberd, is invincible."
Slap
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tú］
["Ji Yun" are cut in the same way, flat mold, fixed. ]
See "Slap".
Slap
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Foot Character Department] 　跿; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1226-14
[Jiyun] The same all cut, the sound disciple. 【Classes】Lump, stumble. Or as a disciple.　 [Historical Records·Zhang Yizhuan] 跿跔科头. [Note] Partially lifted one foot and said stumbling. Note each other in detail.
